result.execSummary:
The defendant Raighee T Day was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Raighee T Day was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Raighee T Day is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Raighee T Day was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
DOC agent to schedule probation review 90 days after reelase on case 14CF851.
Court allowed transfer of probation to State of MO. if accepted.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges  including DV and DNA.  To be paid from 25% of prison funds on case 14CF851 and on this case if revoked, and then during Extended supervision and probation. Failure to pay results in a civil judgment.

Court wavied all nonmandatory court costs, fees and surcharges.

Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of No Contact Order; and due to DV conviction under Federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
Court advised due to felony  conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm  possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

No violent contact with Quianna O., Jerry B. or Angela O.
No contact with firearms.

Batterers Intervention Program.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
AODA assessment. Comply with recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

records.addlTxt: Signed, Filed & Distributed, This Order (Order Rescinding Defendant's Telephone, Visitation, and U.S. Mail Custody Privileges 5/23/2014) is hereby revoked. Day shall have all privileges available to him. This order does not effect he authority of the Sheriff to discipline or modify.

Defendant Raighee T. Day in court with attorney Lucas James Kaster.  Defendant Raighee T. Day in custody.  Michael Davis Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviewed Pre-Sentence Investigation Reports, DOC  & Private, Reviewed letters to the court, and victim impact statements. Sworn by the court: DOC Agent Sylvia Ivory. Testimony. Additional statements by Quianna D. 
AS TO COUNT 3
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 7 YEARS, consecutive, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 5 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Serve 100 DAYS in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No violent contact with vQuianna O. (D.) 
-No contact with Jerry B. or Angela O.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Court ordered defendant to pay all MANDATORY Court Costs, Fees, and Surcharges including DV & DNA, from 25% of prison funds on case 14CF851, and on this case if revoked, and then during Extended Supervision and Probation, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges. 
-Provide DNA Sample.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
*DOC agent to scheduled probation review 90 DAYS after release on case 14CF851.

-Court allowed for transfer of probation to State of M.O., if accepted.

cf
Received and filed with court.

Defendant Raighee T Day in court with attorney Lucas Kaster.  Defendant Raighee T Day in custody.  Michael Davis Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Jury returned at the hour of 9 a.m. to continue deliberations in the charge of Sheriff's Deputy Timothy Brown.  At the hour of 2:14 p.m. the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of NOT GUILTY AS TO COUNTS 1 and 2 and GUILTY AS TO COUNT 3 which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted defense motion for judgment on the verdict and denied state's for judgment not withstanding the verdict and entered judgment of acquittal on Counts 1 and 2.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict on Count 3.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction on that count.  On state's motion, Court Orders PSI report without a recommendation.  Order for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI) signed and FILED.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 23. Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Court ordered defendant can have in-person visit with his mother.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 10-31-2014 at 8:30 am.

Trial proceeded.  State rests on Case #14CM2956, Ct. 3.  Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case on that count, denied by the court.  Court holds colloquey with defendant regarding right to testify.  Jury in the box at 2:26 p.m.  Sworn for the state:  City of Columbia, MO Police Officer Cathy Daldd.  Exhibit #13 (Stipulation) read to the jury.  Jury out of box at 3:40 p.m.  The state provides an alternative to Exhibit #6, which is Exhibit #14 received.  On state's motion, Court ordered Count 3 dismissed.  Jury in box at 4:00 p.m.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Testimony closed.   Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury out of box at 4:52 p.m. Jury to return at the hour of 9 a.m. to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputy Timothy Brown  who was duly sworn for that purpose.  Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 23.  Jury trial scheduled for 08-21-2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Raighee T Day in court with attorney Lucas Kaster.  Defendant Raighee T Day in custody.  Michael Davis Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Jury in box at 10:02 a.m.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee County Sheriff's Detective Mark Gaudynski.  Exhibit #'s 2, 3 and 4 received and played for the jury.  Jury out of box at 11:00  Jury in box at 11:23 a.m.  Court resumes playing Exhibit #'s 2 and 4 for the jury.  Jury out of box at 11:54 a.m.  Court recessed for lunch.

Attorney Lucas Kaster in court, defendant Raighee T Day not in court, in custody.  Michael Davis Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Jury in the box at 2:10 pm. Sworn for the State: Jerry B. Jury out of the box at 2:30 pm. Court held voir dire with Jerry B. Sworn for the State: Angela O. Court held voir dire with Angela O. Jury in the box at 2:45 pm. Testimony of Jerry B. (previously sworn before Jury). Sworn for the state: West Milwaukee Police Officer Joseph Van Der Linden. Received exhibit #5. Testimony of Jerry B., recalled, but remained sworn.  Re-sworn before the Jury: Angela O. Sworn for the state: West Milwaukee Police Officer Sean Patyk. Jury out of the box at 3:56 pm. Jury in the box at 4:10 pm. Sworn for the State: Milwaukee County Sheriff Deputy Lavalle Morgan. Received exhibit #6.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee County Deputy Dennis O'Donnell. Received exhibit #7. Jury instructed and released for the day ordered to return at 8:45 am to branch 23. Court placed side bar conversations on the record. Case adjourned to branch 23  Jury trial scheduled for August 20, 2014 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Raighee T Day in court with attorney Lucas Kaster.  Defendant Raighee T Day in custody.  Michael Davis Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion regarding Strikes for cause, strikes placed on the record. Jury panel in the court at 10:00 am. Voir Dire continued. Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled at 10:08 am. Jury list received and filed.  Remaining panel members released to Jury Management. Jury out of the box at 10:10 am. Jury in the box and sworn at 10:16 am. Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state: West Milwaukee Police Officer Brian Chic. Exhibit #1 received. Jury instructed and released for lunch, ordered to return at 1:45 pm.  Jury out of the box at 11:20. Court placed side bars on the record. Case adjourned to 1:30 pm in branch 23.

Defendant Raighee T Day in court, in custody, with attorney Lucas Kaster.  Michael Davis Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case recalled. Discussion regarding Jury instructions and pretrial motions.  Case passed to allow Jury Panel to appear.   
Case recalled.
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  3:22 pm. Court instructed and released panel for the day, jurors to return to Jury Management at 9:00 am. Panel out of the box at 4:29 pm. Case adjourned for jury Trial to branch 23.  Jury trial scheduled for August 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Case Recalled, appearances remain the same. Court held in chambers conversation with state and defense counsel. Discussion regarding Motions before the court. Motion Hearing proceeded. Sworn for the state: West Milwaukee Police Officer Eric French. Arguments from state and defense counsel. For reasons placed on the record, the court DENIED the motion. Case passed to 1:30 to address court calendar.

Defendant Raighee T Day in court with attorney Lucas Kaster.  Defendant Raighee T Day in custody.  Michael Davis Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Jury Trial. 1st call, parties are ready to proceed. Case passed to address court calendar.
Received & Filed, Motion In Limine.
State's Motion In Support of Joinder, filed by ADA Matt Puthukulam.

Attorney Lucas Kaster in court, defendant Raighee T Day not in court, in custody.  Matthew Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. Court granted joinder of 14CF851, 14CF1805, 14CM832, 14CM600, and new case 14CM2956 over the defense objection. Defense counsel enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND on new case. State's motion to adjourn 8/4/2014 Jury Trial date, GRANTED by the court. Case adjourned for Jury Trial to branch 23.  Jury trial scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Motion To Adjourn.
Per state's request, case set for status conference prior to jury trial date. Matter set for 7/30/2014 at 8:30 am in branch 23.
Received & Filed, Motion In Limine.
Received & Filed, Defendant's Memorandum Opposing Joinder.

Attorney Lucas Kaster in court, defendant Raighee T Day not in court, in custody.  Matthew G Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant NOT produced.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Jury Trial.  State's motioned for joinder of 14CF851, 14CF1805, 14CM832 & 14CM600 GRANTED, defense has 5 DAYS from today's date to file any motions challenging joinder.  Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. State's offer is open until day of trial. Any motions must be filed within 20 days of trial.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial to branch 23.

Defendant Raighee T Day in court with attorney Lucas Kaster.  Defendant Raighee T Day in custody.  Matthew G Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee County Sheriff Deputy Daniel Settingsgarde. Court took judicial notice of regarding case #14CF1805 as stated on the record. State's exhibit #1 & #2 received into evidence.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. State's exhibits # 1 & 2 are withdrawn. Case is adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Raighee T. Day in court, in custody, with attorney Joel Mogren for Lucas Kaster.  Matthew G Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant does not wish to proceed with Attorney Mogren. Court set matter for Preliminary Hearing to allow Attorney Kaster to appear.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 23, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Quiana D. (AKA Quiana O.) or Keeya D  (Defendant refused to sign)

Defendant Raighee T Day in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Defendant Raighee T Day in custody.  David T Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
